age_at_collection_class.description: the age of the individual at time of biosample collection, as ontology object

queries.description: the query will return all biosamples reported in this publication

external_ids.description: list of reference_class objects with properly (e.g. identifiers.org) prefixed external identifiers and a term describing the relationship

queries.description: This query retrieves biosamples with an ISO8601 period value for "followup_time" and a boolean "true" for death.

info.description: This is a wrapper for objects without further specification in the schema.

updated.description: time of the last edit of this record, in ISO8601

geo_provenance.description:
This geo_class attribute ideally describes the geographic location of where the sample was extracted.
Frequently this value may reflect either the place of the laboratory where the analysis was performed, or correspond to the corresponding author's institution.

individual_id.description: In a complete data model "individual_id" represents the identifier of this biosample in the "individuals" collection.

description.description: A free text description of the biosample.

queries.description: The query will return all biosamples with an (exact) class.id of "pgx:icdom:81403" in their "biocharacteristics" object list.
This call to the distinct funcion will return *all* bioterms ids for samples having some ncit id; to retrive only the ncit ids, this has to be followed by a regex filter (/^ncit/).

biocharacteristics.description:
"biocharacteristics" represents a wrapper list of "biocharacteristic_class" objects with properly prefixed term ids, describing features of the biosample.
Examples would be phenotypes, disease codes or other ontology classes specific to this biosample. In a complete data model (variants - (callsets) - biosamples - individuals), characteristics applying to the individual (e.g. sex, most phenotypes) should be annotated there.

age_at_collection.description: the age of the individual at time of biosample collection, as ISO8601 string

id.description: The local-unique identifier of this biosample (referenced as "biosample_id").

info.title: GA4GH __biosample__
info.description: In this schema, a "biosample" as the source of the material of a molecular analysis (e.g. genomic array, sequencing), represents the main “biological item” against which molecular variants are referenced.
